repnme.cdata!: Brazil - Federal Railway Export Corridor Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project was the fifth in a series of
            related loans supported by the Bank in Brazil. The cost of
            the Federal Railway Export Corridor Project was estimated to
            be US$422.0 million, with a Bank Loan of US$200 million
            equivalent. Final project costs were US$373.4 million, with
            US$194.4 million disbursed from the Bank Loan. According to
            the Staff Appraisal Report (SAR) and the Loan Agreement
            (LA), project objectives were the financial rehabilitation
            and improved commercial performance of the Federal Railway
            System; and increased transport efficiency in the two export
            corridors of Parand and Goias- Minas Gerais. To support the
            project's objectives, loan proceeds were to finance:
            (i) a policy development and institutional component which,
            through the use of action plans, would address company-wide
            and sectoral issues; and (ii) an investment component which,
            through strategically located investments, would improve
            transport operations in the two export corridors.

docna.cdata!: Brazil - Federal Railway Export Corridor Project

Brazil - Federal Railway Export
            Corridor Project

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Federal Railway - Export Corridor
            - Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Federal Railway Export Corridor
            Project will provide assistance to RFFSA in the
            implementation of: (i) a set of action plans and programs
            aimed at its financial rehabilitation and at improving its
            commercial performance.  In addition, it will involve; (ii)
            two rehabilitation and improvement projects designed to
            increase transport efficiency in the Parana and Goias-Minas
            Gerais export corridors. The policy and institutional
            development component includes action plans for
            rationalizing the railway's operations and network;
            upgrading tariffs, marketing and cost control; improving
            operations and maintenance efficiency; strengthening
            planning and management systems; and improving transport
            coordination in the Southeast corridors.  The two corridor
            projects essentially include the rehabilitation and
            improvement of the most critical sections of main lines, of
            yards, of workshops and of intermodal facilities.

docna.cdata!: Brazil - Federal Railway - Export Corridor - Project

display_title.display_title:
Brazil - Federal Railway - Export
            Corridor - Project
